channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Kremlin expects the return of a Russian prisoner for releasing Marc Fogel
item.description: The Kremlin said Wednesday it expects a Russian citizen detained in the U.S. to be returned as part of the deal that secured American teacher Marc Fog...

item.title: Kendrick Lamar: America’s Avant-Pop Ambassador
item.description: A ghetto dispatch reveals the gulf between race, sports, music, and spectacle.

item.title: Exclusive: Legal AI startup Harvey lands fresh $300 million in Sequoia-led round as CEO says on target for $100 million annual recurring revenue
item.description: The three-year-old San Francisco AI startup fetched a $3 billion valuation — double the amount investors valued it at in July.

item.title: How Vance’s ‘Do You Hear Yourself?’ Moment Helped Me See The Propaganda Press For What It Is
item.description: J.D. Vance asking Martha Raddatz, 'Do you hear yourself?' was the political reality check I desperately needed.

item.title: ‘Correct The Records’: Trump Administration Requests NCAA Strip Men Of Titles Stolen From Women
item.description: The Education Department requested that the NCAA 'correct the records' of all the female athletes whose titles and awards were stolen by males.

item.title: 6 times judges blocked Trump executive orders
item.description: Federal judges have blocked President Trump's executive orders related to the Department of Government Efficiency and ending birthright citizenship.

item.title: Rate cuts put on ice as consumer inflation surges to a 9-month high
item.description: “We're really not making progress on inflation right now,” said one economist.

item.title: ‘Dune: Part Two’ Isn’t The Only Accidentally Pro-Life Hollywood Blockbuster
item.description: In Oscar-nominated 'Dune: Part Two,' Lady Jessica spends much of the movie communicating telepathically with her unborn daughter, Alia.

item.title: A 78-year-old pilot was killed after the landing gear on his private jet failed. His wife says he died doing what he loved
item.description: Joie Vitosky was certified as a flight engineer since 1978 and a pilot since 2019.
